content.question: Step 1: <math alttext="2 X gas is in equilibrium with X 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.250em"></mspace><mtext>X</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>⇄</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> (fast) Step 2: <math alttext="X 2 gas plus Y gas produces X 2 Y gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>Y</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>Y</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> (slow) The rate law for the hypothetical reaction <math alttext=" 2 X gas plus Y gas produces X 2 Y gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>X</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mtext>Y</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo></mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>Y</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is consistent with the mechanism shown above. Which of the following mathematical equations provides a rate law that is consistent with this mechanism?

choices.label: <math alttext="rate equals k, times the molar concentration of X squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><msup><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mtext>X</mtext><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="rate equals k times the molar concentration of X 2, times the molar concentration of Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mtext>Y</mtext><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="rate equals k, times the molar concentration of X squared, times the molar concentration of Y " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><msup><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mtext>X</mtext><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>[</mo><mtext>Y</mtext><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="rate equals k times the molar concentration of 2 X , times the molar concentration of Y " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mtext>Y</mtext><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="rate equals k, times the molar concentration of X squared, times the molar concentration of Y " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><msup><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mtext>X</mtext><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>[</mo><mtext>Y</mtext><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.B: Identify an appropriate theory, definition, or mathematical relationship to solve a problem.
